results.title: Custody
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Film Australia and Tristram Miall
results.brief_description: Custody follows an estranged couple, Christine and Andrew Byrne, down the twisting and highly emotional path that eventually leads to a fully contested case in the Family Court. Along the way it shows the points of view of both parents, and the somewhat different view taken by the lawyers and the Court Counsellors who become involved. Above all, it dramatically shows what it is like to go through the Family Court. The members of the Byrne family are actors. The legal aid representative, the solicitors, the barristers and members of the judiciary all play themselves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Munro, Film Australia and Tristram Miall

results.title: Custodians of the bush
results.creator_credit: Michael Edols, Mark Falzon and Central Coast Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Under southern skies”.
Sue Henckel travels to far north Queensland to meet Thancoupie, an Aboriginal healer, who explains the ancient tradition of holistic medicine that nurtures, heals and protects. Thancoupie provides an education on the qualities and properties of Australian native flora, showing that it is the hunter gatherers who have provided the rich source of essential substances used in modern medicines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Edols, Mark Falzon and Central Coast Media

results.title: Custard the Dragon
results.brief_description: Everyone, including Belinda, thinks Custard the Dragon is a complete coward until a nasty pirate comes to steal their Xmas presents and Custard deals with him in his own special way.

results.title: Curriculum Victoria: growing and learning
results.creator_credit: Warren Thomas and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A talk by Michael Norman, which highlights the changing expectations our society has for adolescents. With reference to students of 1912, 1948 and 1979, who appear in the program, mention is made of the narrowing academic learning that occurred rather than a broadening of the curriculum.

results.title: Curriculum by Technology
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Bendigo Education Resource Centre, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how Bendigo Education Resource Centre is introducing new technology into distance education to increase the range of curriculum subjects offered for Year 11 and 12 students in isolated schoolos in the Mallee area: Telepaks, telephone links, fax machines, Macintosh computers, lessons on VHS tapes. Introduction by Justin Shortal.

results.title: Current and electromotive force
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”.
Explains the electron theory, discussing arrangement of molecules, building up of current conductors, electromotive force, resistance and chemical and mechanical sources of electromotive force.
